original: 'khor ba'i srid pa sgrol ba po //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ni srid pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i srid pa sgrol ba po // zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ni srid pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe liberator from the existence of cyclic life‚ÄùüîΩmeans that cyclic life is existence.

original: 'khor ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: It is the existence of cyclic life.

original: de la 'don pa rnam pa gnyis ci dgos she na /
analyzed: de la 'don pa rnam pa gnyis ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the need for the two kinds of liberation?

original: yang dag par 'khor bas sems can srid pa rnams su rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'khor bas sems can srid pa rnams su rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug ste /
translated: The lord of yogis, by means of right cyclic life, liberates sentient beings from the existences.

analyzed: ji ltar chu gter du tshong ba gru gzings la phyin pa'i thabs kyis pha rol du 'gro'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug srid pa'i rgya mtshor mi rtag pa'i @186b grus 'gro ba'i thabs kyis rab tu gnas pa'i chos kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i pha rol tu sgrol ba'o //
translated: so the lord of yogis, by means of the boat of impermanence in the ocean of existence, goes by means of the method of liberation to the other side of nirvana by means of the Dharma of establishment.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i srid pa sgrol ba po zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho smra ba'i rab tu gnas pa bya ste de'i tshe nye bar mkho ba kun rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu rnams la rgyas par ni rnam pa du ma rnams
translated: In brief, there are ten types, and in detail, there are many types.

original: so // bcu zhes bya ba ni gser gyi rang bzhin gyi spu gri dang thur ma dang 'bol stan dang / dag byed rnams dang gser gyi yu ba can gyi rnga yab dang yan lag gi snod bhe ri dang bum pa dang da ka rnams te bcu'o //
analyzed: so // bcu zhes bya ba ni gser gyi rang bzhin gyi spu gri dang thur ma dang 'bol stan dang / dag byed rnams dang gser gyi yu ba can gyi rnga yab dang yan lag gi snod bhe ri dang bum pa dang da ka rnams te bcu'o //
translated: The ten are a razor and a scalpel made of gold, a soft cushion, cleansing substances, a yak-tail whisk with a golden handle, a bheri, a pot, and a dhaka.

original: gzhan yang khrus kyi nye bar mkho ba rnams dang de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams kyi gang dgos pa de thams cad gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang khrus kyi nye bar mkho ba rnams dang de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams kyi gang dgos pa de thams cad gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, all the necessary things for bathing and likewise whatever is needed for the ma·πá·∏çala activities should be gathered.

original: 'di lta bu ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni dgos pa'o //

original: ji ltar gzhan du zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid 'dus pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyud du ma rnams su rab gnas la nye bar mkho ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /

analyzed: de rnams thams cad de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as elsewhere‚Äù means that the consecration and so forth that are taught in the various tantras such as the Compendium of Principles are all explained in the same way.

analyzed: rang bzhin zhes pa zhes bya ba ni gang 'dra ba'i dngos po thams cad rnam par dpyad par gyur pas rnam pa thams cad mi bden pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù means that all things are analyzed and are not real in any way.

analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar mi bden /

original: des na thams cad don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /

analyzed: rkyen gyis srid dang mya ngan 'das //

original: snang ba yang ni mi bden te //
analyzed: snang ba yang ni mi bden te //

original: gang zag @187a * //
analyzed: gang zag @187a * //
translated: The person

analyzed: rnams kyis kyang gzhag pa'o //

analyzed: de yis bdag med pa yi gzugs //

analyzed: 'dir gal te lus kyi dngos po gang zag gi gzugs so sor bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid de ji ltar sems so sor 'gyur /

analyzed: 'o na rnam pa thams cad thim par gyur pa'i sems nam mkha'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: de'i tshe ma mthun no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma mthun no //

original: de ni ma yin te ji ltar ma yin /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te ji ltar ma yin /

original: lus la brten pa'i sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems sna tshogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin te de'i tshe gang zag gi sems de nyid lus kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag med pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar gang zag gi bdag med pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir lugs ma'am thang ka rnams sam dam pa'i chos la sogs pa de'i gzugs su rab tu gnas par bya ste /

analyzed: rang gi gzugs rang gi rnal 'byor las byung ba phyi rol du lugs ma la sogs par dmigs par 'phro ba ste /

original: // da ni rab gnas kyi nges pa'i tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: // da ni rab gnas kyi nges pa'i tshig gsungs pa /

original: 'dir 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams su bzhugs pa'i gnas gang mdor bstan pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams su bzhugs pa'i gnas gang mdor bstan pa gsungs te /

analyzed: 'di skad bdag gi la sogs pa nas bzhugs so'i bar du thog ma'i ngag ste /

translated: There, by the characteristics of the Dharma and reality, the form of the Bhagavat is perfectly established, and by becoming one with all dharmas, the perception of the nature of great bliss is the various teachings of the excellent Dharma.

translated: Since this is done in the yoga and yoginƒ´ tantras, all of those excellent dharmas and so on dwell here.

original: gnas gang rnams su dus thams cad du rab tu gnas pa yin /
analyzed: gnas gang rnams su dus thams cad du rab tu gnas pa yin /

original: de ltar 'dir yang 'du shes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir yang 'du shes brjod par bya ste /

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /

translated: The letter e and so on. Here, I will explain in brief the agent: in the letter e, the source of phenomena, the perfection of wisdom, the seal of the realm of phenomena, and the center of the avadh≈´tƒ´ lotus.

original: // dbyibs thob byas nas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pas sngon du rnal 'byor la goms par byas pa gsal ba phyis sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis thams cad dmigs par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar gnas 'dir su'i rab tu gnas pa gsungs pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du pam gi yi ge la rdo rje'i ste rdo rje'i snying po la ste rang gi rig pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the syllable ‚Äúpa·πÉ‚Äù is the vajra, the essence of the vajra, which is the clear light of one‚Äôs knowledge of enlightenment.

original: ma'i yi ge phyag rgya chen po gnyis su med pa'o //

translated: The syllable ‚Äúma‚Äù is the great seal, which is nondual.

original: de ltar theg pa bzhi la sogs pa gang dran pa rab tu gnas pa ni gleng gzhi rnams su phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid can no //

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras mu stegs pa'i khang pa dang lha khang dang khron pa dang rdzing la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: mdor na khams gsum de'i dngos po gang yin par rig par bya'o //

original: thos pa gcig pa sngags kyi don //
analyzed: thos pa gcig pa sngags kyi don //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: brda'i skad de de bzhin du gsungs so //

translated: In the context of the time of the BhagavƒÅn, should be known means that time is the form of time.  Nontime is the time of the exhaustion of all phenomena in the context of enlightenment. The meaning of the words is free from the awareness of self and other.

original: pa'o ; / de'i skabs su gang rab tu gnas pa de rab tu mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / de'i skabs su gang rab tu gnas pa de rab tu mi gnas pa'o //
translated: In that context, whatever is well established is not well established.

original: sus kyang byas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sus kyang byas pa med pa'o //

original: dus thams cad kyi skad cig gcig byang chub kyi skad cig ces bya ba'i don to //

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshig chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa byed pa zhes bya ba ste mnyam pa ni 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshig chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa byed pa zhes bya ba ste mnyam pa ni 'dra ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the ‚Äúword of all tathƒÅgatas‚Äù is the ‚Äúrealm of phenomena,‚Äù which is ‚Äúequal,‚Äù that is, similar, to ‚Äúall enlightenments.‚Äù

translated: The so called sixteen innate perfect bodhisattvas are the four of Dharma, enjoyment, emanation, great bliss and virtue and so on that are mentioned in the first chapter, which are small, medium, great and extremely great.üîΩüîΩ

analyzed: chen po'i rigs pas so //

analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //

translated: The dharmin is the object of that reality, which is the accumulation of wisdom by means of the mantra worship and so forth of the yoginis.

translated: It is the nature of that, and it is the nature of that which is explained as the form of that wisdom preceded by aspiration.üîΩ

original: 'thob pa zhes bya ba ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: 'thob pa zhes bya ba ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of the form of that wisdom preceded by will, and the nature of all that has been explained, the characteristics of the three vehicles, etc. That is asserted as the bases of supernatural power, by which one attains as explained.

original: 'on kyang phyag rgya'i brda yis thams cad ces bya ba ni gang bshad pa dang phyis kyis kyang brda de thams cad ni rnal 'byor gyi dngos grub byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyag rgya'i brda yis thams cad ces bya ba ni gang bshad pa dang phyis kyis kyang brda de thams cad ni rnal 'byor gyi dngos grub byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: However, all by the sign of the seal is that which has been explained and that which will be explained later. All of that is said to be the cause of the accomplishment of the yoga.

original: des rnal 'byor ma bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de'i sbyor ba'i dus rnams su grub pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des rnal 'byor ma bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de'i sbyor ba'i dus rnams su grub pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of the generation of the yoginƒ´s is that they are generated by the accomplished yoginƒ´s in the periods of practice.

original: des kyang dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ji ltar 'khor lo sdom pa chung ngur sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: des kyang dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ji ltar 'khor lo sdom pa chung ngur sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Also, mandala and so forth, the mandala wheel is taught in the Lesser Chakrasamvara as having a nature of thirty-seven.

original: de bzhin du 'di skad cig skad cig la bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni @196b nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di skad cig skad cig la bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni @196b nges pa'o //
translated: Likewise, here it is said, one should meditate on it in every moment, which is certain.

original: dgos pa gang gi phyir bsgom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dgos pa gang gi phyir bsgom pa gsungs pa /
translated: For what purpose is the meditation taught?

original: sum cu rtsa bdun bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun bdag nyid can //
translated: Having thirty-seven natures,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: and so forth.

original: sngags zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sngags zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The mantra is that which will be explained and that which has been taught.

original: des bsgom pa'i rab tu sbyor bas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i rab tu sbyor bas bsgom pa'o //
translated: By the application of meditating on that, there is meditation.

original: dus gang gis zhe na gsungs pa ;
analyzed: dus gang gis zhe na gsungs pa ;
translated: By what time? It is said:

original: / mkha' 'gro ma las zhes bya ba nas gshin rje 'joms ma'i bar rnams te bcu gnyis po rnams kyi chu srin la sogs pa'i phrad pa las skyes pa rnams kyi de rnams kyi re re 'pho ba'i dus rnams su rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa de
analyzed: / mkha' 'gro ma las zhes bya ba nas gshin rje 'joms ma'i bar rnams te bcu gnyis po rnams kyi chu srin la sogs pa'i phrad pa las skyes pa rnams kyi de rnams kyi re re 'pho ba'i dus rnams su rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa de
translated: of the dakinis up to Yamini, the twelve, born from the conjunctions of Capricorn and so forth, in the times of their transits, the fierce lady and so forth,

original: de bzhin du gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni brgya byin la sogs pa lha lus rags pa rnams kyi lo gcig gis nyi ma gcig la sogs pas 'pho ba yang rags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni brgya byin la sogs pa lha lus rags pa rnams kyi lo gcig gis nyi ma gcig la sogs pas 'pho ba yang rags par 'gyur ro //
translated: The other is the coarse bodies of the gods such as Indra, etc. , whose year is one day, etc. , and so on.

original: de bzhin du phra mo sbrang bu la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phra mo sbrang bu la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ste /
translated: Thus, it is also for the subtle, such as insects, etc.

original: de lta de ltar 'gro ba rnams kyi bskyed pa dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta de ltar 'gro ba rnams kyi bskyed pa dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yang ngo //
translated: Thus, it is for the generation of the worlds and also for the yoginis.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /üîΩlo rnams kyi ni tshad rnams su //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / lo rnams kyi ni tshad rnams su //
translated: It is said:üîΩThe measure of the years

original: zhes bya ba ni lo gcig rnams rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bskyed pa'i tshad kyi rtsis rgyun du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lo gcig rnams rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bskyed pa'i tshad kyi rtsis rgyun du'o //
translated: is the measure of the generation of the yoginis.

original: grangs su 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: grangs su 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: The number is said:

original: kha ra sogs dang dus byas nas //
analyzed: kha ra sogs dang dus byas nas //
translated: Having completed the vowels, etc. ,

original: zhes bya ba ni kha'i yi ge la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kha'i yi ge la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: The twenty-four letters beginning with ka

original: de bzhin du ra la sogs pa drug / dus tshod drug ste de ltar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ra la sogs pa drug / dus tshod drug ste de ltar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and likewise the six beginning with ra are the six periods. Thus, it should be placed.

original: ldog pa gnyis dag gis mtshan pa //
analyzed: ldog pa gnyis dag gis mtshan pa //
translated: It is marked with the two reversals.

original: zhes bya ba ni steng dang 'og tu gnyis gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni steng dang 'og tu gnyis gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, two [are placed] above and below.

original: gnyis dag bcu 'gyur du byas nas //
analyzed: gnyis dag bcu 'gyur du byas nas //
translated: Two [are] multiplied by ten.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: [This] is said.

original: lo gcig gi chu tshod ces bya ba ni re re la brgyad brgyad thig le gnyis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lo gcig gi chu tshod ces bya ba ni re re la brgyad brgyad thig le gnyis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One year's hours, that is, each [is] eight hundred. Two drops are given.

original: mdor bsdus pas 'dir 'gyur te gsum gcig tu 'bab /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas 'dir 'gyur te gsum gcig tu 'bab /
translated: In brief, here [it is] three [that] fall together.

original: de ltar lo'i chu tshod rnams kyi chad gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar lo'i chu tshod rnams kyi chad gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the division of the year's hours is stated.

original: chu tshod lnga rnams su zhes bya ba ni 'pho ba gcig rnams kyi rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa chu tshod re re'i nang rnams su rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun rnams kyi bskyed par 'gyur te mdor na lnga po rnams kyi brgyad cu rtsa lngas
analyzed: chu tshod lnga rnams su zhes bya ba ni 'pho ba gcig rnams kyi rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa chu tshod re re'i nang rnams su rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun rnams kyi bskyed par 'gyur te mdor na lnga po rnams kyi brgyad cu rtsa lngas
translated: Five hours, that is, in each of the one revolution, VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, etc., in each of the hours, the thirty-seven yoginƒ´s are generated. In brief, the five [are] eighty-five.

original: lhag pa'i brgya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i brgya'o //
translated: The remainder is one hundred.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma gcig gi tshad ces bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa la bcu nyis 'gyur du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma gcig gi tshad ces bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa la bcu nyis 'gyur du 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, one day's measure, that is, ten times the previously explained [is] twelve.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated.

original: @197a * // nam mkha' mig dang lag pa mig / ces bya ba ni nyis stong nyis brgya nyi shu /
analyzed: @197a * // nam mkha' mig dang lag pa mig / ces bya ba ni nyis stong nyis brgya nyi shu /

original: de bzhin du zla ba gcig gi tshad ces bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa rnams sum cu 'gyur rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba gcig gi tshad ces bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa rnams sum cu 'gyur rnams te /
translated: Similarly, the measure of one month is the thirty-fold increase of what was previously explained.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: mkha' mkha' ro dang dus tshod ro //
analyzed: mkha' mkha' ro dang dus tshod ro //
translated: Space, space, taste, time, taste,

original: zhes bya ba ste drug khri drug stong drug brgya nyi shu /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste drug khri drug stong drug brgya nyi shu /
translated: and so on, are sixty-six thousand six hundred and twenty.

original: de bzhin du lo gcig gi tshad ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa rnams bcu nyis 'gyur rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lo gcig gi tshad ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa rnams bcu nyis 'gyur rnams te /
translated: Similarly, the measure of one year is the twelve-fold increase of what was previously explained.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i lha mo rnams kyi sngags kyi yi ge rnams las bskyed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i lha mo rnams kyi sngags kyi yi ge rnams las bskyed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the author teaches the generation from the mantra syllables of the goddesses of the mandala wheel.

original: gsang sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩrtsa pa'i sngags rnams su zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa rnams su ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / rtsa pa'i sngags rnams su zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa rnams su ste /
translated: The mantra and so forth.

original: de'i rkang pa gnyis gnyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi rkang pa gnyis gnyis rnams te rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sngags gcig ni rang gi sngags kyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rkang pa gnyis gnyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi rkang pa gnyis gnyis rnams te rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sngags gcig ni rang gi sngags kyi rkang pa'o //
translated: The mantra syllables are the forty-eight lines, and the two lines each are the two lines each of the twenty-four yoginis. The mantra of the yoginis is the line of their own mantra.

original: de ltar rkang pa gsum rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rkang pa gsum rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the generation of the yoginis of the mandala wheel is by the three lines.

original: de'i sngags la sbyor gyi bdag nyid yi ge re re bar du bcug pa rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i sngags la sbyor gyi bdag nyid yi ge re re bar du bcug pa rnams gsungs pa /
translated: He teaches the mantra syllables, inserting each syllable into the self-union.

original: aom tri ne zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: aom tri ne zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Om trini and so forth are easy to understand.

original: rtag tu rgya mtsho dang mnyam pa can zhas bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u lnga bcu par mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'i sgrub thabs su gsungs pa ste rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' bo rnams de dang mnyam par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rtag tu rgya mtsho dang mnyam pa can zhas bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u lnga bcu par mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'i sgrub thabs su gsungs pa ste rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' bo rnams de dang mnyam par 'gyur bas so //
translated: The always ocean-like is taught in the fifty-first chapter, the method of achieving the dakini ocean, because the yoginis and heroes become equal to that.

original: de ltar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid du gnas nas thams cad 'char ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid du gnas nas thams cad 'char ba'o //
translated: Thus, having remained in the nature of wisdom and means, everything arises.

original: de yang rab mchog bde ba 'thob //
analyzed: de yang rab mchog bde ba 'thob //
translated: And that is the attainment of supreme bliss.

original: ces bya ba ni bla ma'i man ngag gis mchog tu gnyis su med pa thob pa ni dgos pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bla ma'i man ngag gis mchog tu gnyis su med pa thob pa ni dgos pa ste /
translated: The attainment of the supreme nonduality by the guru's intimate instruction is the purpose.

original: nyi shu rtsa gsum la sogs pa'i le'u gsum gang rnams su gang bshad pa de thams cad 'bab pa rnams kyis phyogs @197b sna tshogs pa yongs su rig pa'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gsum la sogs pa'i le'u gsum gang rnams su gang bshad pa de thams cad 'bab pa rnams kyis phyogs @197b sna tshogs pa yongs su rig pa'o //
translated: The various directions are the three chapters beginning with the twenty-third, which explain everything that falls into the various directions.

original: de nyid kyi man ngag gis ye shes zla ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni dgos pa thams cad de theg pa gsum la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i bstan bcos su bshad pa rnams zla ba ltar 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa rnams su ye shes kyi rang bzhin
analyzed: de nyid kyi man ngag gis ye shes zla ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni dgos pa thams cad de theg pa gsum la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i bstan bcos su bshad pa rnams zla ba ltar 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa rnams su ye shes kyi rang bzhin
translated: The nature of the moon of intuition is the nature of intuition that is like the moon, the light of which is clear, of all the purposes, that is, of all the various treatises explained in the three vehicles and so forth.

original: rnams rig ba zhes bya ba ne de yang 'dis so //
analyzed: rnams rig ba zhes bya ba ne de yang 'dis so //
translated: The nature of intuition is that which is like the moon.üîΩBy this means that by this, the nature of intuition that is like the moon, the various buddhas emit light.

original: 'di rnams 'chang bas te rtag tu spro zhing yongs su sdud pa'i sbyor bas sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas bye ba rnams kyis spro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams 'chang bas te rtag tu spro zhing yongs su sdud pa'i sbyor bas sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas bye ba rnams kyis spro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of emit is that they always emit light by the yoga of being expansive and fully inclusive.

original: de ltar ye shes zla ba'i 'od zer ci la skyes pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes zla ba'i 'od zer ci la skyes pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is said that the light of the moon of intuition is born from something.

original: tshangs pa'i sgo nga zhes bya ba ste dpral ba'i dbus su 'phyang ba'i rtsa dgu pa 'gog pas byang chub kyi sems gyen du 'bab pa de'i 'od zer gyis gzugs ye shes kyi rnam par 'gyur bas 'od de de la de bzhin du gsungs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgo nga zhes bya ba ste dpral ba'i dbus su 'phyang ba'i rtsa dgu pa 'gog pas byang chub kyi sems gyen du 'bab pa de'i 'od zer gyis gzugs ye shes kyi rnam par 'gyur bas 'od de de la de bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: The cakra of Brahma is the central channel that hangs down in the middle of the forehead. By blocking it, the bodhicitta descends upward. The light of that emits forms that are the manifestations of intuition. That light is said to be like that.

original: da ni kun du spyod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni kun du spyod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now the conduct is taught:

original: kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúConduct‚Äù and so forth.

original: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'pho ba 'di rnams thams cad kyi dus su sngags las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi yi ge brjod pa'i dus tsam gyis te /
analyzed: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'pho ba 'di rnams thams cad kyi dus su sngags las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi yi ge brjod pa'i dus tsam gyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúAt all times‚Äù means at the time of all these transferences. ‚ÄúFrom the mantra‚Äù means just at the time of uttering the mantra syllables.

original: rang rang gi sngags kyi yi ge'i dus rnams su'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi sngags kyi yi ge'i dus rnams su'o //
translated: It is at the times of one‚Äôs own mantra syllables.

original: 'dir kun tu spyod pa ni longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang bdag tu byed pa'i rim pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir kun tu spyod pa ni longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang bdag tu byed pa'i rim pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here the conduct should be described in terms of the stages of enjoyment, dissolution, and self-mastery.

original: de yang sngon du bshad pa'i ji ltar khva gdong ma la sogs pa brgyad rnams kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang sngon du bshad pa'i ji ltar khva gdong ma la sogs pa brgyad rnams kyi bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the activity of the eight beginning with KƒÅkavaktrƒÅ as previously explained.

original: de bzhin du 'dir rab tu gtum mo la sogs pas bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir rab tu gtum mo la sogs pas bya'o //
translated: Likewise, here it is done by Praca·πá·∏çƒÅ and so forth.

original: 'on kyang 'dir kun du spyod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir kun du spyod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: However, here there are two kinds of conduct.

original: gcig ni rdo rje phag mo brjes nas des rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa'i gnas su phyin nas dpa' bo thams cad dang longs spyod do //
analyzed: gcig ni rdo rje phag mo brjes nas des rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa'i gnas su phyin nas dpa' bo thams cad dang longs spyod do //
translated: One is that after exchanging with VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, she goes to the places of Praca·πá·∏çƒÅ and so forth and enjoys with all the heroes.

original: gnyis pa ni rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa rang gis 'khor lo'i dpa' bo rnams la 'ongs nas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa rang gis 'khor lo'i dpa' bo rnams la 'ongs nas so //
translated: The second is that the heroes of one's own wheel, beginning with Ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´, come to the heroes of the wheel.

original: yang na thams cad rdo rje phag mo'i gnas su bzhud nas so //
analyzed: yang na thams cad rdo rje phag mo'i gnas su bzhud nas so //
translated: Or else, all of them go to the abode of VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´.

original: de ltar byas pas cir 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas cir 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
translated: Having done it that way, what happens?

original: 'du ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mchog gi dngos grub ces bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'du ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mchog gi dngos grub ces bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: It is said, the gathering, etc. The supreme attainment is the nature of the essence of all phenomena.

original: des byung ba'i 'jig rten rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rgyu las so //
analyzed: des byung ba'i 'jig rten rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rgyu las so //
translated: The cause of the attainment of the great seal of the worlds that arise from that is the cause.

original: yang @198a * //
analyzed: yang @198a * //

analyzed: ao di ya na'i yi ge rnams rim pa ji lta bas sku zhes bya ba ni ao'i yi ge ni sprul pa'i sku'o //

translated: Moreover, it exists, and this one who is engaged in all mundane and supramundane virtues, who is the basis of the bases of magical power, becomes the one who displays miracles, etc., in the middle of the world.

analyzed: grol ba'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni ji ltar der gnas pa @204b rnams kyi mtshan nyid de bzhin du gling 'dir thar pa'i rgyus bsgrub par bya ba ste /

analyzed: yon tan kun bdag stong pa nyid // ces bya ba ni 'di rnams thams cad kyi yon tan rnams ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pas stong pa nyid rab tu gsal ba'i yon tan de de ltar rab tu gsal ba'i stong pa nyid kyi yon tan dang bral bas 'khor ba las dgrol
translated: The emptiness of all qualitiesüîΩis the cause of the liberation of the world.üîΩThe qualities of all of these are the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on.üîΩThe emptiness that is the cause of the qualities of the illumination of emptiness is the quality of the illumination of emptiness.

original: ba'i rgyu thabs gzhan med pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i rgyu thabs gzhan med pa yin no //

analyzed: de la rdo rje zhes bya ba ni gung mo dbus su byas nas lhag ma rtse mo'i rnam pas phyogs bzhir gzhag pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o // ral gri zhes bya ba ni sdigs mdzub steng du bzung nas ral gri'i khu tshur gyi tshul ni / @206b ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Therein, the ‚Äúvajra‚Äù is the vajra gesture, made by placing the middle fingers together in the center, with the remaining fingers in the form of tips in the four directions.üîΩThe ‚Äúsword‚Äù is the sword gesture, made by holding the index finger above, in the form of a sword fist.

original: mdung rings zhes bya ba ni khu tshur gyi bcings nas gung mo rab tu brkyang pa ni mdung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdung rings zhes bya ba ni khu tshur gyi bcings nas gung mo rab tu brkyang pa ni mdung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúspear‚Äù is the spear gesture, made by extending the middle finger in the closed fist.

original: rtse gsum zhes bya ba ni rgan po dang mthe'u chung bzung ste sor mo lhag ma rnams steng du kha phye bar byas pa ni rtse gsum pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rtse gsum zhes bya ba ni rgan po dang mthe'u chung bzung ste sor mo lhag ma rnams steng du kha phye bar byas pa ni rtse gsum pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The three-pointed mudra is made by holding the ring finger and little finger of the right hand and spreading the remaining fingers upward.

original: dgra sta zhes bya ba ni sor mo thams cad rab tu brkyang ste mthe bong gyen du bskyod ba ni dgra sta'i phyag rgya'o //üîΩgri gug ces bya ba ni khu tshur bcings te sdigs mdzub rab tu brkyang nas der sdigs mdzub kyi tshigs gnyis par mthe bos bkab pa ni gri gug gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dgra sta zhes bya ba ni sor mo thams cad rab tu brkyang ste mthe bong gyen du bskyod ba ni dgra sta'i phyag rgya'o // gri gug ces bya ba ni khu tshur bcings te sdigs mdzub rab tu brkyang nas der sdigs mdzub kyi tshigs gnyis par mthe bos bkab pa ni gri gug gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The axe mudra is made by extending all the fingers and raising the thumb upward.üîΩThe curved knife mudra is made by clenching the fist and extending the index finger, then covering the second joint of the index finger with the thumb.

original: mda' zhes bya ba ni gung mo dang ming med dang mthe'u chung bskums te mthe bong gis bzung nas sdigs mdzub brkyang ste mda'i lag pa'i tshul du byas pa ni mda'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mda' zhes bya ba ni gung mo dang ming med dang mthe'u chung bskums te mthe bong gis bzung nas sdigs mdzub brkyang ste mda'i lag pa'i tshul du byas pa ni mda'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The arrow mudra is made by bending the middle finger, ring finger, and little finger and holding them with the thumb, then extending the index finger in the shape of an arrow.

original: gsal shing gis phug pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad ba'i keng rus kyi tshul du bzung ngo //
analyzed: gsal shing gis phug pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad ba'i keng rus kyi tshul du bzung ngo //
translated: The pierced by a stake mudra is held in the same way as the previously explained skeleton.

original: tho ba zhes bya ba ni khu tshur brdeg pa'i rnam par byas pa ni tho ba'i phyag rgya'o //üîΩ'khor lo zhes bya ba ni khu tshur bcings te sdigs mdzub kyi mthe bong gi rtse mo reg ste bskum pa ni 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: tho ba zhes bya ba ni khu tshur brdeg pa'i rnam par byas pa ni tho ba'i phyag rgya'o // 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni khu tshur bcings te sdigs mdzub kyi mthe bong gi rtse mo reg ste bskum pa ni 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúhammer‚Äù is the fist striking in the form of a hammer; this is the mudrƒÅ of the hammer.üîΩThe ‚Äúdiscus‚Äù is the fist with the index finger touching the tip of the thumb; this is the mudrƒÅ of the discus.

original: da ma ru zhes bya ba ni khu tshur bcings nas rgan po bskyod pa ni da ma ru'i phyag rgya'o //üîΩchu gri zhes bya ba ni khu tshur byas nas mthe'u chung rab tu brkyang ba ni chu gri'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: da ma ru zhes bya ba ni khu tshur bcings nas rgan po bskyod pa ni da ma ru'i phyag rgya'o // chu gri zhes bya ba ni khu tshur byas nas mthe'u chung rab tu brkyang ba ni chu gri'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúhand-drum‚Äù is the fist with the index finger shaking; this is the mudrƒÅ of the hand-drum.üîΩThe ‚Äúsword‚Äù is the fist with the little finger extended; this is the mudrƒÅ of the sword.

original: dbyug pa zhes bya ba ni sdigs mdzub dbyug pa'i tshul du rnam par bzung ba ni dbyug pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dbyug pa zhes bya ba ni sdigs mdzub dbyug pa'i tshul du rnam par bzung ba ni dbyug pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúclub‚Äù is the index finger held in the form of a club; this is the mudrƒÅ of the club.

original: sor mo thams cad bskum nas reg pa 'dis ni rtse gcig pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sor mo thams cad bskum nas reg pa 'dis ni rtse gcig pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúsingle-pointed‚Äù is all the fingers folded in and touching; this is the mudrƒÅ of the single-pointed.

original: dung zhes bya ba ni khu tshur byas nas sdigs mdzub la mthe bong gi rtse mos reg nas rtse mo'i rnam pa ni dung gi phyag rgya'o //üîΩzangs dung zhes bya ba ni khu tshur khar bzung ba ni zangs dung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dung zhes bya ba ni khu tshur byas nas sdigs mdzub la mthe bong gi rtse mos reg nas rtse mo'i rnam pa ni dung gi phyag rgya'o // zangs dung zhes bya ba ni khu tshur khar bzung ba ni zangs dung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The conch is made by forming a fist and touching the tip of the thumb to the tip of the index finger extended; the form of the tip is the conch mudra.üîΩThe copper conch is made by holding the fist to the mouth; it is the copper conch mudra.

original: dbyu gu zhes bya ba ni sdigs mdzub bskyod par gyur pa'i tshul gyis dbyu gu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu zhes bya ba ni sdigs mdzub bskyod par gyur pa'i tshul gyis dbyu gu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The staff is made by shaking the index finger; it is the staff mudra.

original: rma bya'i mjug ma der zhes bya ba ni sor mo lnga bskyod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rma bya'i mjug ma der zhes bya ba ni sor mo lnga bskyod par gyur pa'o //
translated: The peacock tail is made by shaking the five fingers.

original: bya rog gshog pa skra'i shad ces bya ba ni sor mo thams cad rab tu brkyang pa'i rtse mo reg pa'o //
analyzed: bya rog gshog pa skra'i shad ces bya ba ni sor mo thams cad rab tu brkyang pa'i rtse mo reg pa'o //
translated: The crow wings are made by touching the tips of all the extended fingers.

original: me'i thab ces bya ba ni lag pa brkyang ba'i sor mo bkug pa ni me'i thab kyi phyag rgya'o //üîΩri bo dang zhes bya ba @207a * //
analyzed: me'i thab ces bya ba ni lag pa brkyang ba'i sor mo bkug pa ni me'i thab kyi phyag rgya'o // ri bo dang zhes bya ba @207a * //
translated: The fire altar is made by bending the fingers of the extended arm; it is the fire altar mudra.

original: ni lag pa gyen la rab tu brkyang pa ni ri bo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: ni lag pa gyen la rab tu brkyang pa ni ri bo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mountain is made by extending the arm upward; it is the mountain mudra.

original: dbyug pa ni sdigs mdzub steng du'o //
analyzed: dbyug pa ni sdigs mdzub steng du'o //
translated: The club is made by extending the index finger upward.

original: me long zhes bya ba ni lag pa'i mthil steng du me long gi rnam par ston pa ni me long gi phyag rgya'o //üîΩpi wang zhes bya ba ni sor mo bzhi gyen du bya ba ni sor mo bzhi /
analyzed: me long zhes bya ba ni lag pa'i mthil steng du me long gi rnam par ston pa ni me long gi phyag rgya'o // pi wang zhes bya ba ni sor mo bzhi gyen du bya ba ni sor mo bzhi /
translated: The ‚Äúmirror‚Äù is the palm of the hand, and the display of the form of a mirror is the mirror gesture.

original: byas nas rgan po bskyod pas thams cad la reg pa ni pi wang gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: byas nas rgan po bskyod pas thams cad la reg pa ni pi wang gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúlute‚Äù is the four fingers raised up, and having made the four fingers, the shaking of the old is the touching of all, and this is the lute gesture.

original: rkang pa'i bol zhes bya ba ni lag pa rkang pa'i tshul du bzung ba'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i bol zhes bya ba ni lag pa rkang pa'i tshul du bzung ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúball of the foot‚Äù is the hand held in the manner of a foot.

original: lag pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi lag pa bskyod par gyur pa'o //üîΩglo ba zhes bya ba ni khu tshur byas nas gung mo rab tu brkyang pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi lag pa bskyod par gyur pa'o // glo ba zhes bya ba ni khu tshur byas nas gung mo rab tu brkyang pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúhand‚Äù is one‚Äôs own hand moving.üîΩThe ‚Äúheart‚Äù is the clenched fist with the index finger extended.

original: rgyu ma zhes bya ba ni khu tshur dbus stong par byas pa ni rgyu ma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma zhes bya ba ni khu tshur dbus stong par byas pa ni rgyu ma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúintestines‚Äù is the clenched fist with the middle finger empty in the center, and this is the intestine gesture.

original: r'a hu zhes bya ba ni sor mo rab tu brkyang nas bskum ste mgo bo'i tshul ni r'a hu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: r'a hu zhes bya ba ni sor mo rab tu brkyang nas bskum ste mgo bo'i tshul ni r'a hu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚ÄúRƒÅhu‚Äù is the fingers extended and bent in the manner of a head, and this is the RƒÅhu gesture.

original: sgrog ces bya ba ni khu tshur gyi nang du mthe bong sbyar bas sgrog gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sgrog ces bya ba ni khu tshur gyi nang du mthe bong sbyar bas sgrog gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrƒÅ of the fetter is formed by joining the thumbs inside the fists.

original: gdos zhes bya ba ni khu tshur bcings nas mthe bong mthar bzung ste gung mo dang ming med nang du brkyang ba ni gdos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gdos zhes bya ba ni khu tshur bcings nas mthe bong mthar bzung ste gung mo dang ming med nang du brkyang ba ni gdos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrƒÅ of the chain is formed by clenching the fists and holding the thumbs at the end, with the middle and ring fingers extended inside.

original: du bhus zhes bya ba ni tho ba bzhin te lag pa thal gong du sbyar ba ni du bhu sa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: du bhus zhes bya ba ni tho ba bzhin te lag pa thal gong du sbyar ba ni du bhu sa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrƒÅ of the club is like a hammer, with the hands joined at the chest.

original: dra ba zhes bya ba ni lag pa brkyang ba'i sor mo 'phyang bar 'gyur ba kha phye ba ni dra ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dra ba zhes bya ba ni lag pa brkyang ba'i sor mo 'phyang bar 'gyur ba kha phye ba ni dra ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrƒÅ of the net is formed by extending the arms and letting the fingers hang down, opening it.

original: ske bcad ces bya ba ni mthe'u chung dang ming med mthe bos mnan nas gung mo dang sdigs mdzub rkang pa'i tshul du 'phyang bar bstan pa ni mgo med lus kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: ske bcad ces bya ba ni mthe'u chung dang ming med mthe bos mnan nas gung mo dang sdigs mdzub rkang pa'i tshul du 'phyang bar bstan pa ni mgo med lus kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrƒÅ of the headless body is formed by pressing the little and ring fingers with the thumbs, and showing the middle and index fingers hanging down like legs.

original: mar nag 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni lag pa brkyang pa byas nas mthe bong sbyar te gzhan phyed bskum nas lag pa lan gsum bskor ba ni 'bar ba'i mar khu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mar nag 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni lag pa brkyang pa byas nas mthe bong sbyar te gzhan phyed bskum nas lag pa lan gsum bskor ba ni 'bar ba'i mar khu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúblazing oil‚Äù is to extend the hand, join the thumbs, bend the other [fingers], and rotate the hand three times. This is the mudrƒÅ of the blazing oil.

original: 'jigs byed gzugs zhes bya ba ni rang gi spyi bo lag pas mnan nas kha 'jigs par byed pa'i rnam par bstan pa ni 'jigs byed gzugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed gzugs zhes bya ba ni rang gi spyi bo lag pas mnan nas kha 'jigs par byed pa'i rnam par bstan pa ni 'jigs byed gzugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúform of Bhairava‚Äù is to press one‚Äôs head with the hand and show the mouth in the form of Bhairava. This is the mudrƒÅ of the form of Bhairava.

original: 'di rnams kyi dgos pa dang byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dgos pa dang byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purpose and function of these are stated:

original: rlung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWind‚Äù and so forth.

original: ma lus rlung gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ma lus rlung gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of all winds.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan thams cad rlung gi rang bzhin gyi nang gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan thams cad rlung gi rang bzhin gyi nang gi bdag nyid de /
translated: All mudrƒÅs and replies to mudrƒÅs are of the nature of the winds, internal.

original: de brdas rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de brdas rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: They function by means of signs.

original: de'i tshe de'i rigs @207b zhes bya ba ste zhing skyes ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams thams cad kyi rang rang gi rigs kyi rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan ma rang gis 'dzin pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rigs @207b zhes bya ba ste zhing skyes ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams thams cad kyi rang rang gi rigs kyi rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan ma rang gis 'dzin pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, they are of that type, that is, all of these yoginis, such as the field-born, etc., are of the form of their own clan, and they are the signs of their own nature.

original: gcig tu na mtshan ma tsam ma yin te gang dang gang zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus kyi dbyibs kyang ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: gcig tu na mtshan ma tsam ma yin te gang dang gang zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus kyi dbyibs kyang ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: In one way, they are not just signs, but whatever, that is, the shape of their own body, is explained in that way.

original: de ltar rjes su 'dzin pa dang tshar gcod par nus pa rlung gi mtshan ma'i rang bzhin rnams sems can rnams kyi rang rang gi dus su 'byung bar byed pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su 'dzin pa dang tshar gcod par nus pa rlung gi mtshan ma'i rang bzhin rnams sems can rnams kyi rang rang gi dus su 'byung bar byed pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Thus, the purpose is that the signs of the wind, which are capable of both protecting and destroying, occur for sentient beings at their own time.

original: de'i slar yang byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i slar yang byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Again, the function is stated

original: bco brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: bco brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: by the eighteen, etc.

original: 'dir stong pa nyid bcu drug ni rab tu grags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid bcu drug ni rab tu grags pa ste /
translated: Here, the sixteen emptinesses are well known.

original: bco brgyad pa ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: bco brgyad pa ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is there an eighteenth? It is stated:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni stong pa nyid bcu drug ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni stong pa nyid bcu drug ste /
translated: In the Perfection Vehicle, there are sixteen kinds of emptiness.

original: de ni der rab tu grags pa ste gsang sngags kyi tshul 'dir lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni der rab tu grags pa ste gsang sngags kyi tshul 'dir lhag pa'o //
translated: They are well known there, but they are not special to that vehicle.

original: de gang ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can gang zag gi bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du chos kyi bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de gang ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can gang zag gi bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du chos kyi bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: They are the emptiness of the person, which is the emptiness of the wisdom and consciousness that constitute the person, and the emptiness of phenomena, which is the emptiness of the self of phenomena.

original: de ltar snying rje yang bco brgyad ces bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gis stong pa nyid gang yin pa de dngos po rnam par dpyod pa'i rkyen gyis ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: de ltar snying rje yang bco brgyad ces bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gis stong pa nyid gang yin pa de dngos po rnam par dpyod pa'i rkyen gyis ni snying rje'o //
translated: Thus, compassion is also of eighteen kinds.

original: de ltar sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Thus, there are thirty-six.

original: de ltar 'di rnams su yang grub pa'i rkyen gyis ma 'dres pa la sogs pa phyag rgya'i lan sum cu rtsa drug gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di rnams su yang grub pa'i rkyen gyis ma 'dres pa la sogs pa phyag rgya'i lan sum cu rtsa drug gis shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these are to be understood by the thirty-six replies of the seals, such as the unmixed, by way of the conditions of their establishment.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid de yang skye bo thams cad kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid de yang skye bo thams cad kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the definition of the consort of Yoginƒ´, as explained, is also the nature of all people.

original: tha mal pa de ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: tha mal pa de ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that ordinary person? It is said:

original: 'dir yang sems can thams cad kyi rnam par gzhag pa thams cad mnyam pa'i dus kyi rigs kyi tha mal par 'dus byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir yang sems can thams cad kyi rnam par gzhag pa thams cad mnyam pa'i dus kyi rigs kyi tha mal par 'dus byas pa rnams so //
translated: Here, all the arrangements of all sentient beings are equal. The ordinary person is composed of the elements.

original: de ji ltar sems de kho na las thams cad du 'gro ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar sems de kho na las thams cad du 'gro ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that mind alone goes everywhere?

original: de ltar legs pa byas pa dang nyes pa byas pa'i gzugs rnams su 'gro ba drug tu sangs rgyas la sogs pas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar legs pa byas pa dang nyes pa byas pa'i gzugs rnams su 'gro ba drug tu sangs rgyas la sogs pas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the well-done and ill-done forms go to the six realms, and the Buddhas, etc., arise.

original: da ni 'dir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis nges pa'i go 'phang gis gnas pa rnams kyi byed pa ngan pa spangs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas 'thob ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis nges pa'i go 'phang gis gnas pa rnams kyi byed pa ngan pa spangs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas 'thob ste /
translated: Now, here, those who abide in the state of certainty of the Yoginƒ´s, having abandoned bad actions, attain Buddhahood.

original: ming gi yi ge'i @208a * //
analyzed: ming gi yi ge'i @208a * //
translated: The syllables of the name

original: rab tu sbyor ba la sogs pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba la sogs pas gsungs pa /
translated: are said to be the application, etc.

original: sna chen ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste shar pa zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyi bag chags kyi mtshan nyid gang gis sangs rgyas nyid ster ba po ste rang gis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du skye ba 'di
analyzed: sna chen ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste shar pa zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyi bag chags kyi mtshan nyid gang gis sangs rgyas nyid ster ba po ste rang gis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du skye ba 'di
translated: The great nose and so on. Arisen is that which was previously explained as the nature of the mudra, the characteristic of the latent tendencies, which grants buddhahood. By oneself is the arising of direct perception in this life.üîΩ

original: nyid kyis te de de bzhin du bshad do //üîΩm'a zhes bya ba la sogs pas m'a'i yi ge'i don te m'a ni dbus ma las steng du gtsug tor la sogs pa'i mtha' nas mthe bo'i mthar de la blta zhing blta bas gsang bar byas nas mthar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyid kyis te de de bzhin du bshad do // m'a zhes bya ba la sogs pas m'a'i yi ge'i don te m'a ni dbus ma las steng du gtsug tor la sogs pa'i mtha' nas mthe bo'i mthar de la blta zhing blta bas gsang bar byas nas mthar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The one called MahƒÅnƒÅsƒÅ and so on.  The one called rising is the nature of the previously explained mudrƒÅ, the characteristic of the latent tendencies, who grants buddhahood.  By oneself means in this very life, directly.  That is explained in the same way.

original: ma byung bar thams cad du thim par song ba'i bsam pa las so //
analyzed: ma byung bar thams cad du thim par song ba'i bsam pa las so //
translated: The meaning of the syllable mƒÅ and so on is: mƒÅ is from the middle, above, from the end of the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a and so on, to the end of the thumb.  Looking at that, having made it secret by looking, one should unite in the end.  From the thought that has dissolved everywhere into the unarisen.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten chen po la khyab pa sangs rgyas rnam par shes pa'i rgyun sngon gyi chos la yongs su 'dris pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nye bar bsags pa las phyis sems can rnams la khyab pa ste sna tshogs gzugs can nor bu ji bzhin no
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten chen po la khyab pa sangs rgyas rnam par shes pa'i rgyun sngon gyi chos la yongs su 'dris pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nye bar bsags pa las phyis sems can rnams la khyab pa ste sna tshogs gzugs can nor bu ji bzhin no
translated: Later, it pervades sentient beings, having various forms like a jewel.

original: zhes bya'o // h'a'i yi ge'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // h'a'i yi ge'i don gsungs pa /

analyzed: h'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bshad pa'i lta ba'i sbyor bas phreng ba phyar ba'i n'a da'i bdag nyid do //

original: thams cad du zhu bas mtshams rnams su yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du zhu bas mtshams rnams su yang ngo //
translated: Since it melts everywhere, it is also in the intermediate directions.

original: de'i tshe rang gis rig pa'i h'a'i yi ge n'a da ni sgra tsam gyi rang bzhin gyi bde ba'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu phrad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gis rig pa'i h'a'i yi ge n'a da ni sgra tsam gyi rang bzhin gyi bde ba'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu phrad pa ste /
translated: At that time, the nƒÅda of the letter H, which is one's own awareness, is extremely subtle, having the nature of sound and bliss.

original: de 'phyang ba'i kha ni 'og tu 'phyang ba zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de 'phyang ba'i kha ni 'og tu 'phyang ba zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba de ni sangs rgyas te gzhan med do //
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba de ni sangs rgyas te gzhan med do //
translated: That one is the Buddha, who is free from all conceptual thought, such as mine, and so on, and who is not another.

original: n'a'i yi ge'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: n'a'i yi ge'i don gsungs pa /

original: n'a da zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: n'a da zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: NA DA, and so on.

original: 'dis h'a'i yi ge'i don kun rdzob kyi don du ston pa ste /üîΩde ltar n'a dar gnas zhes bya ba ni dpral ba nas kha 'og tu 'phyang ba de'i ba thag dang 'dra ba byang chub kyi sems kyi skud pa thams cad du bde ba gnyis su med pa'i phreng ba ste khams kyi snal mas te des de ltar sbyor
analyzed: 'dis h'a'i yi ge'i don kun rdzob kyi don du ston pa ste / de ltar n'a dar gnas zhes bya ba ni dpral ba nas kha 'og tu 'phyang ba de'i ba thag dang 'dra ba byang chub kyi sems kyi skud pa thams cad du bde ba gnyis su med pa'i phreng ba ste khams kyi snal mas te des de ltar sbyor
translated: This teaches the meaning of the syllable HA as the meaning of the conventional.

original: bas mi 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: bas mi 'pho ba ste /
translated: Thus, in the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´ means that, like a thread in a pearl necklace, the thread of bodhicitta hangs down from the forehead to below the mouth. The garland of the two kinds of bliss is the thread of the elements. By connecting it in that way, it is not lost.

original: de'i de ltar s'a'i yi ges gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i de ltar s'a'i yi ges gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated by the syllable SA:

original: sgrub thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mngon par rtogs pa'i man ngag gis 'khor lo bzhi la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sgrub thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mngon par rtogs pa'i man ngag gis 'khor lo bzhi la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid do //

original: de'i a'a li k'a li sngon byung ba zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang dbugs 'jug pa rnam par gzung bas 'pho ba med par @208b 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i a'a li k'a li sngon byung ba zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang dbugs 'jug pa rnam par gzung bas 'pho ba med par @208b 'gyur ba ste /

original: de ltar yi ge bzhis brtags pa ni ma h'a n'a sa'i yi ge bzhi phyag rgya'i mngon par brjod pa nyid de chos zhes bya ba ni chos kyi phyag rgya ste thog ma'i yi ges so //
analyzed: de ltar yi ge bzhis brtags pa ni ma h'a n'a sa'i yi ge bzhi phyag rgya'i mngon par brjod pa nyid de chos zhes bya ba ni chos kyi phyag rgya ste thog ma'i yi ges so //
translated: Thus, the examination by four syllables is the four syllables of mahƒÅnƒÅsƒ´, the very expression of the seal. The dharma is the dharma-seal, by the first syllable.

analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni las kyi phyag rgya ste gnyis pas so //

original: dam tshig ces bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste gsum pas so //
analyzed: dam tshig ces bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste gsum pas so //

original: phyag rgya chen po yi ge bzhi pas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po yi ge bzhi pas so //
translated: The great seal is by the fourth syllable.

original: rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i m'a la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi'i sbyor ba rnams phyag rgya'i rang bzhin te de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i m'a la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi'i sbyor ba rnams phyag rgya'i rang bzhin te de de bzhin du bshad do //

analyzed: da ni gnas la sogs pa'i ming gis yi ge'i rnam par gzhag pa dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams su yang ste sgrub thabs kyi le'ur le'u 'di nam mkha'i 'khor lor yongs su bzhag pas 'du ba dang / de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po 'dir sngags las byung ba'i gsungs pa /

original: gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas de phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams te de ltar rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas de phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams te de ltar rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The words place, etc., in the half-verse beginning with place are the words of the brief explanation of the words of the brief explanation. Thus, it is easy to understand.

analyzed: de la rgyas par bshad pa rnams gsungs pa /

original: thog ma zhes bya ba nas 'joms pa'o de yang ni zhes bya ba'i bar du phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rnams kyi gnas kyi yi ge rnams kyi'o//
analyzed: thog ma zhes bya ba nas 'joms pa'o de yang ni zhes bya ba'i bar du phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rnams kyi gnas kyi yi ge rnams kyi'o//

analyzed: sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyed kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i'o //

analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyed kyis nam mkha'i 'khor lo'i'o //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas phat phat ces bya ba'i bar rnams kyis kyang bdag po bsgom pa'i'o //
translated: The verse beginning ma·πá·∏çala up to pha·π≠ pha·π≠ refers to the meditation on the lord.

analyzed: thog ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas aa'i yi ge gsungs pa /
translated: The verse beginning at the beginning refers to the letter A.

original: thog ma tha mar sna'i dbugs //
analyzed: thog ma tha mar sna'i dbugs //

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i m'a la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i m'a la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: refers to the application of the previously explained mƒÅ and so on.

original: de yang phyag rgya bzhi'i mtshan nyid rnams su bzhi po rnams su 'di shin tu rgyas par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang phyag rgya bzhi'i mtshan nyid rnams su bzhi po rnams su 'di shin tu rgyas par bshad pa ste /
translated: Moreover, in the characteristics of the four seals, these four are explained in great detail.

analyzed: dbu mar rab tu zhugs pa na gtsug tor la sogs pa nas rkang pa'i mthe bo'i bar du de de bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: When entering the central channel, from the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a and so on up to the toes, it is said to be just so.
