analyzed: de'i phyir / 'jig dang gnas dang ldang ba spang bar bya //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Abandoning creation, abiding, and rising.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: h'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sngon ma'i dbus su zhes bya ba la sogs pas ra'i yi ges gsungs pa /üîΩmtshon zhes @209a * //
analyzed: h'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sngon ma'i dbus su zhes bya ba la sogs pas ra'i yi ges gsungs pa / mtshon zhes @209a * //
translated: The mark

original: bya ba ni lta ba'i sbyor bas tshigs thams cad du zhu ba'i byang chub kyi sems rang gis rig par mtshon pa ste sems kyi yongs su chags pa tsam nyid de yang spangs pa ni mtshon pa bral zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang
analyzed: bya ba ni lta ba'i sbyor bas tshigs thams cad du zhu ba'i byang chub kyi sems rang gis rig par mtshon pa ste sems kyi yongs su chags pa tsam nyid de yang spangs pa ni mtshon pa bral zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang
translated: is the bodhicitta that melts into all the joints through the yoga of seeing. The markless is the abandonment of just the complete attachment of the mind, that is, the perfection of all conceptualization.

original: bral ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor ma thams cad de /
analyzed: bral ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor ma thams cad de /
translated: The perfection of all yoginƒ´s is the other side of being free from all conceptualization.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis thams cad sgyu ma grub pa rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'khor ba'i 'khor lor zhugs shing de la brten pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis rol pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis thams cad sgyu ma grub pa rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'khor ba'i 'khor lor zhugs shing de la brten pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis rol pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of play is that all are established as illusions by the form of the Buddha, and by the nature of the yoginƒ´s, they enter the wheel of samsƒÅra and are based on that. The meaning of play is the nature of the gnosis that is based on that.

original: n'a da zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang sngon gyi bu bam zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: n'a da zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang sngon gyi bu bam zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: The syllable na and so forth is also the previous ba·πÉ and so forth.

original: bu'i yi ges yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: bu'i yi ges yang gsungs pa /
translated: The son's syllable is uttered again.

original: bu bam zhes bya ba ni slar yang byang chub kyi sems kyi snal ma bde ba'i gzugs gnyis su med par sgra'i bdag mo 'gro zhes bya ba ni sgra'i yon tan rnams su bkang ba ste sgra ni dbyangs kyi bdag nyid de sa'i yi ge sngon ma'i bar
analyzed: bu bam zhes bya ba ni slar yang byang chub kyi sems kyi snal ma bde ba'i gzugs gnyis su med par sgra'i bdag mo 'gro zhes bya ba ni sgra'i yon tan rnams su bkang ba ste sgra ni dbyangs kyi bdag nyid de sa'i yi ge sngon ma'i bar
translated: Bam is the thread of the bodhicitta, the form of bliss, nondual, filled with the mistress of sound, going, that is, with the qualities of sound. Sound is the nature of the vowels, the previous syllable of the earth.

original: phyi nas ra'i yi ges tsheg drag ste ha'i yi ge ae byas nas de ltar sa: ste bdag mo bzhin ham du 'gro'o //
analyzed: phyi nas ra'i yi ges tsheg drag ste ha'i yi ge ae byas nas de ltar sa: ste bdag mo bzhin ham du 'gro'o //
translated: After that, the syllable ra is the visarga. The syllable ha is made into e, and thus sa becomes ham like the mistress.

original: sv'a'i yi ge gzhan pa'i yang ba phyi bas au'i yi ger 'gyur ba ste bdag mo byang chub kyi bu mo gnyis su med pa'i gtsang spra ldan ma de'i dbus su gam ga 'bab pa mo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sv'a'i yi ge gzhan pa'i yang ba phyi bas au'i yi ger 'gyur ba ste bdag mo byang chub kyi bu mo gnyis su med pa'i gtsang spra ldan ma de'i dbus su gam ga 'bab pa mo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The syllable sva is the other va of the outside, which becomes the syllable u, the mistress, the daughter of enlightenment, endowed with nondual purity. In the middle of that, ga is falling, that is, the channel.

original: de nas rtsa gam ga 'pho ba med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ye shes 'bab pa mo'o //
analyzed: de nas rtsa gam ga 'pho ba med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ye shes 'bab pa mo'o //
translated: Then, the channel ga is the falling of the gnosis of the bodhicitta that does not move.

original: sbyor ba gang gis 'bab pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang gis 'bab pa gsungs pa /
translated: The method by which it falls is stated:

original: sgrub thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The means of achievement and so forth.

original: sngon du bshad pa'i gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang dha'i yi ges gsungs pa /üîΩgzhu 'gengs pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni gzhu 'gengs pa ni ji ltar gzhu yis bskyod par gyur pas 'ben 'bugs te /
analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang dha'i yi ges gsungs pa / gzhu 'gengs pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni gzhu 'gengs pa ni ji ltar gzhu yis bskyod par gyur pas 'ben 'bugs te /
translated: The two and so forth explained previously are also stated by the syllable D.üîΩThe application of drawing a bow is as follows: Just as an arrow is shot by drawing a bow, and the shooter is so called because of the movement of the bow, in the same way, the application of the vajra and lotus is so called because of the drawing of the bowstring of the life and downward winds.

original: 'bugs pa po ni de bzhin du srog dang thur sel dag gis gzhu'i rgyud drangs pas rnam par bzung bas 'pho ba med pa ste rdo rje dang padma yongs su sbyor ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bugs pa po ni de bzhin du srog dang thur sel dag gis gzhu'i rgyud drangs pas rnam par bzung bas 'pho ba med pa ste rdo rje dang padma yongs su sbyor ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having drawn it, one should not release it, but rather hold it. The meaning is that by this, one should hold the upward-moving wind in the central channel.

original: 'di byas pas dgos pa cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di byas pas dgos pa cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: Having done this, what is the purpose? It is stated:

original: mda' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'di ni shes par bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: mda' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'di ni shes par bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The arrow and so forth. This is the meaning of the words to be understood.

original: de ltar mtshon zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa ste bstan pas rnam par rtog pa med pas mtshon pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i @209b don to //
analyzed: de ltar mtshon zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa ste bstan pas rnam par rtog pa med pas mtshon pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i @209b don to //
translated: Thus, the weapon and so forth are as explained previously. By the teaching, one is free from conceptualization, and the meaning is that one is free from the weapon of conceptualization.

original: de yang ni zhes bya ba ni sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i don te /
analyzed: de yang ni zhes bya ba ni sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i don te /
translated: Moreover, by that is the meaning of the bases of magical powers, as in mind, etc.

original: sems rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid can sngon du bshad pa'i gzhu 'gengs pa'i sbyor bas 'gugs te /
analyzed: sems rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid can sngon du bshad pa'i gzhu 'gengs pa'i sbyor bas 'gugs te /
translated: The mind, which has the nature of non-conceptualization, is drawn forth by the previously explained method of drawing the bow.

original: gang du gtsug tor gyi bar du byas nas /
analyzed: gang du gtsug tor gyi bar du byas nas /
translated: Having done that up to the crown protuberance,

original: des rdzu 'phrul gyis spogs par byas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des rdzu 'phrul gyis spogs par byas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by that, one should increase magical power, it is said.

original: nam mkha' 'khor lo las gzhan gyi gnas su spogs par bya ste /üîΩde yang ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub thabs kyi le'ur nam mkha'i 'khor lor phyag rgya'i brda 'chad pas dpa' bo dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis der bskyed pa ste de yang ye shes ma'i mngal can bzhin zhes bya ba ste ji ltar ma'i
analyzed: nam mkha' 'khor lo las gzhan gyi gnas su spogs par bya ste / de yang ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub thabs kyi le'ur nam mkha'i 'khor lor phyag rgya'i brda 'chad pas dpa' bo dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis der bskyed pa ste de yang ye shes ma'i mngal can bzhin zhes bya ba ste ji ltar ma'i
translated: One should increase magical power in a place other than the wheel of space.

original: mngal na gnas pa'i skye bo rnams kyi sems ye shes tsam gyi gzugs kyi thams cad du dbye ba med pas bltas pas so //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i skye bo rnams kyi sems ye shes tsam gyi gzugs kyi thams cad du dbye ba med pas bltas pas so //
translated: Moreover, by wisdom, etc. In the chapter on the means of accomplishment, the symbols of the consorts in the wheel of space are explained, and the lords of heroes and heroines are generated there. Moreover, like the womb of wisdom, it is said. Just as the minds of beings in the womb of a mother are merely wisdom forms, everywhere undifferentiated, so one should view the world.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems rnam par rtog pa med pa ye shes kyi bdag nyid can nam mkha'i 'khor lo la sogs pa thams cad du rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems rnam par rtog pa med pa ye shes kyi bdag nyid can nam mkha'i 'khor lo la sogs pa thams cad du rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the yogis should analyze everything, the wheel of space, etc., with the mind that is free from conceptual thought, and has the nature of intuition.

original: snying po la sogs par 'chags pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: snying po la sogs par 'chags pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The creation in the essence, etc., creation is understood.

original: de gang gi gzugs kyis bskyed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gang gi gzugs kyis bskyed pa gsungs pa /
translated: He declares the form in which it is created:

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The wheel of the mandala, etc.

original: rgyu 'dis bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu 'dis bskyed pa ste /
translated: It is created by this cause,

original: slar yang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sngon du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dbus su bsgom par bya ste sna chan po 'dis bzhugs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: slar yang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sngon du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dbus su bsgom par bya ste sna chan po 'dis bzhugs par bya ba'o //
translated: and again, the wheel of the mandala, having the characteristics explained previously, should be meditated in the middle, and should be made to abide by this great nose.

original: de ltar shes rab thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Thus, wisdom and means, etc., all are easy to understand.

original: 'on kyang sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas kun du spyod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas kun du spyod par bya ba'o //
translated: However, one should practice by the reasoning explained previously.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las sna chen po'i brda'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid dang ming gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / de bzhin du bdag po'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par gzhag pa rgyas par bstan pa'i cho ga le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las sna chen po'i brda'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid dang ming gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / de bzhin du bdag po'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par gzhag pa rgyas par bstan pa'i cho ga le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: The commentary on the great king of tantras of Yoginƒ´, the Ocean of Dakas, the Ship, explains the characteristics of the rite of the great nose-sign, the presentation of the letters of the name, and so on, and likewise, the rite of the extensive presentation of the nature of the lord in chapter twenty-nine.

original: // / dpa' blo ma la phyag byas nas //üîΩnye ba'i gnas kyis gang bdag gis //
analyzed: // / dpa' blo ma la phyag byas nas // nye ba'i gnas kyis gang bdag gis //
translated: Having bowed to the heroine's intellect,

original: lus brda'i rang bzhin can gyis ni //
analyzed: lus brda'i rang bzhin can gyis ni //
translated: I, with a body of the nature of signs,

original: de yi bka' yis rgya cher byas //
analyzed: de yi bka' yis rgya cher byas //
translated: by her command, have extensively composedüîΩthis presentation of the signs of the body.

original: da ni sum cu pa dpa' po'i blo gros ma'i @210a * //üîΩbrda la sogs pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sum cu pa dpa' po'i blo gros ma'i @210a * // brda la sogs pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, chapter thirty explains the signs of the hero's intellect, and so on.

original: de nas lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The signs of the body, and so on, are explained in the lines beginning Then, the body, and so on.

original: dpa' blo ma'i rab sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yi ge la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba ste de yang rab tu sbyor ba ni phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan 'di rnams thams cad la mngon par 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' blo ma'i rab sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yi ge la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba ste de yang rab tu sbyor ba ni phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan 'di rnams thams cad la mngon par 'brel par bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúapplication of the hero‚Äôs mind‚Äù is the application of the syllables and so forth that will be explained. That application is to be applied to all of these gestures and counter-gestures.

original: gang gis de ltar lha rdzas lus skyes zhes bya ba ni de'i nye bar spyod pas de dang mnyam par 'gro ba ste rjes su dran pas so //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar lha rdzas lus skyes zhes bya ba ni de'i nye bar spyod pas de dang mnyam par 'gro ba ste rjes su dran pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy whom, born with a divine body in that way,‚Äù by the enjoyment of that, one goes to the same place as that, by recollection.

original: de'i mdzes shing brgyan pa'i lus kyi brda bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i mdzes shing brgyan pa'i lus kyi brda bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The meaning is that the gestures of the body of that beautiful and adorned body should be explained.

original: de ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that? It is said:

original: mgo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas lto ba zhes bya ba'i bar rnams ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi phyag rgya lus kyi gnas sum cu rtsa drug rnams su lag pa g-yon pas reg pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas lto ba zhes bya ba'i bar rnams ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi phyag rgya lus kyi gnas sum cu rtsa drug rnams su lag pa g-yon pas reg pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHead‚Äù and so forth up to ‚Äúbelly‚Äù are the thirty-six bodily places of the yoginƒ´s, touched by the left hand.

original: de bzhin du 'di la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis lan gyi phyag rgya sbyin par bya ba de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis lan gyi phyag rgya sbyin par bya ba de gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, the reply-seals to be given by the yoginis here are stated.

original: gling bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rin chen zhes bya ba'i bar rnams kyis de ltar rnam par du ma'i rang rang gi tshul rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba ste //
analyzed: gling bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rin chen zhes bya ba'i bar rnams kyis de ltar rnam par du ma'i rang rang gi tshul rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba ste //
translated: By flute and so forth up to jewel, they are to be given in that way by their respective methods.

original: 'dir rtogs par sla bas kho bos ma bris so //
analyzed: 'dir rtogs par sla bas kho bos ma bris so //
translated: Here, since they are easy to understand, I will not write about them.

original: da ni phyag rgya 'di rnams kyi gnas dang rnal 'byor ma'i ming gi yi ge'i sgo nas dgos pa dang byed pa'i rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya 'di rnams kyi gnas dang rnal 'byor ma'i ming gi yi ge'i sgo nas dgos pa dang byed pa'i rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the purpose and function of these seals is stated from the perspective of their locations and the names of the yoginis.

original: go drang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: go drang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: By Gaudaland and so forth.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: One verse summarizes.

original: dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rang bzhin can te /
translated: The faculty of faith is the nature of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: 'dzag pa'i snying po las skyes bde //
analyzed: 'dzag pa'i snying po las skyes bde //
translated: The bliss born from the essence of emission

original: phung po khams sogs khams la'o //
analyzed: phung po khams sogs khams la'o //
translated: is in the aggregates, constituents, and so forth.

original: rdo rje padma yongs sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: rdo rje padma yongs sbyor ba'i //
translated: The union of the vajra and lotus

original: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba rab tu gnas //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba rab tu gnas //
translated: is the practice of the seal.

original: gnyis kyi dngos po rab spang zhing //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po rab spang zhing //
translated: Abandoning the duality of things,

original: ye shes tsam gyi nang du son //
analyzed: ye shes tsam gyi nang du son //
translated: one enters into mere consciousness.

original: lan gyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: lan gyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: By the nature of the seal of response,

original: sil snyan sogs kyis kyang sgrar 'gro //
analyzed: sil snyan sogs kyis kyang sgrar 'gro //
translated: it becomes sound through musical instruments and so forth.

original: dbang po rnams kyi bder son pas //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi bder son pas //
translated: By attaining the bliss of the senses,

original: gang dang der ni lhung ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang der ni lhung ba'o //
translated: it falls into that and that.

original: rang bzhin 'dir mi shes bya ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'dir mi shes bya ste //
translated: This nature should be known here:

original: yang dag sangs rgyas dngos gzugs can //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas dngos gzugs can //
translated: the perfect Buddha has a form of substance.

original: dngos po gzugs ni bsam dpyad de //
analyzed: dngos po gzugs ni bsam dpyad de //
translated: The substance is the form that is contemplated,

original: de dngos sangs rgyas 'du shes so //
analyzed: de dngos sangs rgyas 'du shes so //
translated: and that substance is the perception of the Buddha.

original: de'i phyir byang chub phyogs kyis ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub phyogs kyis ni //
translated: Therefore, by the factors of enlightenment,

original: chos ni rang gis dad dbang po'o //
analyzed: chos ni rang gis dad dbang po'o //
translated: the Dharma is one's own faith faculty.

original: de ltar rgyu yi lam du ni //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu yi lam du ni //
translated: Thus, in the path of the cause,

original: dpa' blo ma bzhin gnas @210b pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' blo ma bzhin gnas @210b pa'o //
translated: it abides like a hero's mind.

original: don dam par ni ye shes nyid //
analyzed: don dam par ni ye shes nyid //
translated: In the ultimate, it is wisdom itself,

original: thams cad sangs rgyas rang bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad sangs rgyas rang bzhin 'gyur //
translated: and all becomes the nature of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams kyi dgos par gyur pas na de bzhin du rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig rnams su byed par kun rdzob kyi sgo nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams kyi dgos par gyur pas na de bzhin du rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig rnams su byed par kun rdzob kyi sgo nas gsungs pa /
translated: Since the words of the brief explanation are the purpose, the words of the extensive explanation are made in the same way, as stated from the perspective of the relative.

original: b'i zhes bya ba lhan skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: b'i zhes bya ba lhan skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúthus‚Äù and ‚Äúinnate‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar slar yang b'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni b'i'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar slar yang b'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni b'i'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: Thus, again, the two verses beginning with ‚Äúthus‚Äù are the meaning of the syllable ba.

original: mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pas gcig gis ra'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pas gcig gis ra'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: One verse beginning with ‚Äúnight‚Äù is the meaning of the syllable ra.

original: chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyed kyis ma'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyed kyis ma'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: One and a half verses beginning with ‚Äúgreat‚Äù is the meaning of the syllable ma.

original: de las skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyed kyis t'i'i yi ge'i don zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyed kyis t'i'i yi ge'i don zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One and a half verses beginning with ‚Äúborn from that‚Äù is the meaning of the syllable ta.

original: 'dir ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Here, one may ask, how is it?

original: b'i zhes bya ba lhan skyes skad la zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i gzugs nyid kyis te /
analyzed: b'i zhes bya ba lhan skyes skad la zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i gzugs nyid kyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù and ‚Äúinnate‚Äù and so on is the form of separation.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: b'i zhes bya ba rnam par 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: b'i zhes bya ba rnam par 'joms pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù is the conqueror.

original: de ltar bdag nyid las skyes pa'i rtog pa thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid las skyes pa'i rtog pa thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: Thus, all thoughts born from oneself are free from passion.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig tu rgyud sna tshogs pa rnams su gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig tu rgyud sna tshogs pa rnams su gsungs pa ste /
translated: The moment of innate joy is said to be the various continuums.üîΩThe remaining joy of separation is the experience of the ultimate.üîΩThe special passion is clearly manifest by meditation.

original: lhag ma bral ba'i dga' ba zhes bya ba nyams su myong ba'i mtha'i nyid kyi tshig gis khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'dod chags bsgom pas rab tu gsal bar mthar thug par son pa ni bla ma'i man ngag gis te mi mo'i padmar zhugs pas min zhes bya
analyzed: lhag ma bral ba'i dga' ba zhes bya ba nyams su myong ba'i mtha'i nyid kyi tshig gis khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'dod chags bsgom pas rab tu gsal bar mthar thug par son pa ni bla ma'i man ngag gis te mi mo'i padmar zhugs pas min zhes bya
translated: The ultimate is reached by the guru's instruction, not by entering the lotus of a human woman.

original: ba'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i skad de /
analyzed: ba'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i skad de /
translated: Passion is the innate moment.

original: de yang sum cu rtsa drug dngos bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang sum cu rtsa drug dngos bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That is also said to be the nature of thirty-six entities.

original: phung po la sogs pa bla ma'i man ngag gis 'dod chags chen pos zhu bas khams re re 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du 'gro'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa bla ma'i man ngag gis 'dod chags chen pos zhu bas khams re re 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du 'gro'o //
translated: By the guru's instruction, the aggregates and so on are melted by great passion, and each element becomes free from passion.

original: de gsungs pa phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste las zhes bya ba ni las kyi dang po'o //
analyzed: de gsungs pa phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste las zhes bya ba ni las kyi dang po'o //
translated: He declares that in the verse beginning with ‚Äúaggregates.‚Äù ‚Äú Action‚Äù is the first action.

original: las can zhes bya ba ni las kyi dbang po'i yul lo //
analyzed: las can zhes bya ba ni las kyi dbang po'i yul lo //
translated: ‚Äú Agent‚Äù is the object of the action of the sense faculties.

original: phung po la sogs pa de rnams su zhe na /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa de rnams su zhe na /
translated: What are those aggregates, etc.?

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du phyed dang rnam par shes pa dang ye shes so //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du phyed dang rnam par shes pa dang ye shes so //
translated: They are form, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, and also wisdom.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang ye shes kyi khams rnams te /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang ye shes kyi khams rnams te /
translated: They are the elements of earth, water, fire, air, space, and wisdom.

original: yul gyi sgra ni de bzhin 'dir //
analyzed: yul gyi sgra ni de bzhin 'dir //
translated: The term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is used here in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg dang chos rnams dang drug go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg dang chos rnams dang drug go //
translated: They are the six: form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.

original: @211a * // dbang po zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: @211a * // dbang po zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid ces bya'o //
translated: The sense faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: las kyi dbang po zhes bya ba ni ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang bshad lam dang gci lam dang ye shes so //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po zhes bya ba ni ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang bshad lam dang gci lam dang ye shes so //
translated: The action faculties are speech, hands, feet, anus, and the organ of generation.

original: las kyi dbang po'i bya ba'i yul rnams ni sna brjod dang len pa dang 'gro ba dang bshad pa dang gci ba dang khu ba 'dzag pa rnams so //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po'i bya ba'i yul rnams ni sna brjod dang len pa dang 'gro ba dang bshad pa dang gci ba dang khu ba 'dzag pa rnams so //
translated: The objects of the action faculty are the nose, speech, excretion, walking, sexual intercourse, and urination.

original: de ltar drug drug gi rim pas sum cu rtsa drug de rnams su'o //
analyzed: de ltar drug drug gi rim pas sum cu rtsa drug de rnams su'o //
translated: Thus, in the order of six by six, there are thirty-six.

original: phung po la sogs pa nang du son pa zhes bya ba ni nges par thim pa nyid thob pa ste ye shes ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa nang du son pa zhes bya ba ni nges par thim pa nyid thob pa ste ye shes ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The internalized aggregates are the attainment of the dissolution itself, because of the nature of gnosis, which is the nature of gnosis.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid de gzhan sangs rgyas kyi dngos po la sogs pa spangs par gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid de gzhan sangs rgyas kyi dngos po la sogs pa spangs par gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the nature of the connate is not abandoned, which is the nature of the Buddha, etc.

original: de ltar lhan cig skyes pa la slob par 'gyur ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ngag tu nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar lhan cig skyes pa la slob par 'gyur ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ngag tu nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, for the yogis who are training in the connate, that experience will be in the voice.

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dis kyang ra'i yi ge'i don te gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dis kyang ra'i yi ge'i don te gsungs pa /
translated: Night and day, etc. This also is the meaning of the syllable ra. It is said:

original: mtshan mo zhes bya ba ni rtsed mo'i dus so //
analyzed: mtshan mo zhes bya ba ni rtsed mo'i dus so //
translated: Night is the time of play.

original: nyin mo zhes bya ba ni bza' ston la sogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: nyin mo zhes bya ba ni bza' ston la sogs pa'i dus so //
translated: Day is the time of eating, drinking, etc.

original: de yang ji srid nyi ma phyed nas nam phyed ni mtshan mo'o //
analyzed: de yang ji srid nyi ma phyed nas nam phyed ni mtshan mo'o //
translated: Moreover, from noon to midnight is night,

original: nam phyed nas nyi ma phyed kyi bar du ni nyin mo'o //üîΩ'di'i rab tu sbyor ba re re byas nas mnyam pa'i dus rnams su lhan cig skyes pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su dran par byas nas g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i rtsa aa wa dh'u t'ir rab tu bcug nas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi
analyzed: nam phyed nas nyi ma phyed kyi bar du ni nyin mo'o // 'di'i rab tu sbyor ba re re byas nas mnyam pa'i dus rnams su lhan cig skyes pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su dran par byas nas g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i rtsa aa wa dh'u t'ir rab tu bcug nas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi
translated: and from midnight to noon is day.

original: rnal 'byor bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having performed each of these practices, one should practice the yoga of the nature of wisdom and means, having recalled the innate perfect enlightenment at the times of equality, having inserted the left and right channels into the avadh≈´tƒ´.

original: slar yang mtshan mo ni rtsa g-yon pa nas byang chub kyi sems 'bab pas rtsed mo'o //
analyzed: slar yang mtshan mo ni rtsa g-yon pa nas byang chub kyi sems 'bab pas rtsed mo'o //
translated: Again, night is play, because the bodhicitta flows through the left channel.

original: de bzhin du nyin mo rtsa g-yas pa 'dod chags khrag las byung ba rnam par rtog pa thams cad za ba'am bza' ba dang nyin mo'i dus dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyin mo rtsa g-yas pa 'dod chags khrag las byung ba rnam par rtog pa thams cad za ba'am bza' ba dang nyin mo'i dus dag go //
translated: Likewise, during the day, the right channel, which is the nature of passion and arises from blood, consumes or eats all concepts, and it is the time of the day.

original: de ltar shes rab thabs bdag nyid can du zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i sbyor bar bsgom pa la gnas pas phyi rol kyang bsgrub par bya'o zhes 'dis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab thabs bdag nyid can du zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i sbyor bar bsgom pa la gnas pas phyi rol kyang bsgrub par bya'o zhes 'dis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, one who is of the nature of wisdom and means means that one who abides in the cultivation of the yoga of the explanation should also accomplish the external.

original: lhan skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lhan skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is stated by innate and so on.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi sbyor ba grub pa'i rgyus nyams su myong ba ni las kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig mngon sum du bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi sbyor ba grub pa'i rgyus nyams su myong ba ni las kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig mngon sum du bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The those is the experience of the accomplishment of the yoga of the nature of wisdom and means, which is to be accomplished in the presence of the karma consort.

original: de rnams ni sum cu rtsa drug tu dbye bas phye @211b ba'i lhan cig skyes ma'i rnal 'byor ma rnams sum cu rtsa drug gi rigs las byung ba sngon du bshad pa'i bram ze mo la sogs pa'i le'u bco lnga par yon tan gyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni sum cu rtsa drug tu dbye bas phye @211b ba'i lhan cig skyes ma'i rnal 'byor ma rnams sum cu rtsa drug gi rigs las byung ba sngon du bshad pa'i bram ze mo la sogs pa'i le'u bco lnga par yon tan gyi 'khor lo ste /

original: bzhi po 'di rnams kyang de ltar mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'i rgyud 'dir mdor bstan pa ste rgyas par bshad pa gzhan du rtogs par bya zhes bya ba ni he'i rdo rje la sogs pa dang bde mchog gi rnal 'byor rnams su gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams kyang de ltar mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'i rgyud 'dir mdor bstan pa ste rgyas par bshad pa gzhan du rtogs par bya zhes bya ba ni he'i rdo rje la sogs pa dang bde mchog gi rnal 'byor rnams su gsungs pa'o //
translated: These four are taught in brief in this ·∏åƒÅka-sa·πÉvara Tantra, and the extensive explanation should be understood elsewhere.

original: de ltar re re'i khams rnams kyi skabs las 'dir skye bar 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar re re'i khams rnams kyi skabs las 'dir skye bar 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, in each case, the meaning is that ‚Äúone should be born here.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang de ltar de kho na nyid sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid mi'u thung ma'i ming gi yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba las bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar de kho na nyid sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid mi'u thung ma'i ming gi yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba las bskyed pa ste /
translated: However, in this way, the reality that is generated by the application of the syllables of the name of the dwarf woman, which has the nature of thirty-six principles,

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: is stated:

original: me'i thung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ming gi yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba 'dis shes par bya ste /
analyzed: me'i thung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ming gi yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba 'dis shes par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe dwarf woman‚Äù and so on. This should be understood by the application of the syllables of the name.

original: sngags pas ni slob dpon gyi cho ga sngon du song bas phyag rgya ye shes mtshon bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags pas ni slob dpon gyi cho ga sngon du song bas phyag rgya ye shes mtshon bar bya'o //
translated: The mantrin, having previously performed the rite of the master, should indicate the knowledge seal.

original: de ltar mkha' mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pas kha'i yi ge'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar mkha' mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pas kha'i yi ge'i don te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the syllable kha is stated by ‚Äúequal to space,‚Äù etc.

original: mkha' mnyam sgo glegs phreng ba ni //
analyzed: mkha' mnyam sgo glegs phreng ba ni //
translated: The garland of doors and bolts equal to space

original: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rnam pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo bzhir skyes pa dang sna tshogs pa'i bde ba rnams su phreng ba'i rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rnam pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo bzhir skyes pa dang sna tshogs pa'i bde ba rnams su phreng ba'i rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: is the garland of the four cakras of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s of the form of space, and the various kinds of bliss that arise, abiding in the form of a garland.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi mkha' spyod ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can rnal 'byor ma rnams de'i gnas su spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid bdag por spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi mkha' spyod ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can rnal 'byor ma rnams de'i gnas su spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid bdag por spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yoginƒ´s, who are of the nature of the space-traveling knowledge and consciousness, enjoy that place, that is, one enjoys oneself as the lord.

original: gang gis bdag por 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gis bdag por 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
translated: By what is one made a lord?

original: dag ces bya ba la sogs pas b'a'i yi ge'i don te gang de dang po'i yi ge sngon du bshad pa'i thung du dang ring po dag gis bshad pa'i phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dag ces bya ba la sogs pas b'a'i yi ge'i don te gang de dang po'i yi ge sngon du bshad pa'i thung du dang ring po dag gis bshad pa'i phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan rnams kyis so //
translated: The meaning of the letter va is stated by ‚Äúpure,‚Äù etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid du 'gog pas rang gi sems kyi spyod par nye bar 'gro ba ste rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid du 'gog pas rang gi sems kyi spyod par nye bar 'gro ba ste rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mudras and replies to the mudras that were explained by the short and long vowels of the first letter are stopped in the nature of that, and so one goes to one‚Äôs own mental activity, which means ‚Äúthe nature of non-conceptuality.‚Äù

original: de'i de ltar nges ba'i tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i de ltar nges ba'i tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the etymology is stated:

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúsecret,‚Äù etc.

original: @215a * // ri'i yi ge'i don gyis sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis gsang ba'i ye shes kyi khams mtha' ma yin pa spros pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: @215a * // ri'i yi ge'i don gyis sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis gsang ba'i ye shes kyi khams mtha' ma yin pa spros pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the letter ri is that the secret element of pristine consciousness is the end of the mind and mental factors, which is just elaboration.

original: slar yang gsal 'thob ces bya ba ni spros pa med pa nyid de rang gi sems kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: slar yang gsal 'thob ces bya ba ni spros pa med pa nyid de rang gi sems kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain, clarity is obtained‚Äù is just non-elaboration by means of one‚Äôs own mind and the conventional truths.

original: rin chen rdo rje'i bar du lhan cig skyes pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa rnams su mthong bar 'gyur te rnam pa med pa nyid kyis de'i bltas pa'i bar du zhes bya ba ste rdo rje dang padma'i bar du gang mthong ba de de bzhin du bshad
analyzed: rin chen rdo rje'i bar du lhan cig skyes pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa rnams su mthong bar 'gyur te rnam pa med pa nyid kyis de'i bltas pa'i bar du zhes bya ba ste rdo rje dang padma'i bar du gang mthong ba de de bzhin du bshad
translated: The seeing up to there, up to the vajra and lotus, is explained as it is.

original: do // gzugs de rtags gang gis shes par bya zhe na de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: do // gzugs de rtags gang gis shes par bya zhe na de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: By what sign is that form known? Therefore it is said:

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste bzhi bzhi'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi po de yang re re la rnam pa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste bzhi bzhi'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi po de yang re re la rnam pa bzhi rnams te /
translated: ‚Äúall‚Äù and so on. The nature of four sets of four is that each of those four joys has four aspects.

original: de yang lus dang nag dang yid dang ye shes kyi dga' ba rnams so //
analyzed: de yang lus dang nag dang yid dang ye shes kyi dga' ba rnams so //
translated: Moreover, they are the joys of body, speech, mind, and gnosis.

original: de ltar yang lus kyi mchog dga' la sogs pa sbyar bar bya ste de bzhin du lus kyi lhan skyes la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar yang lus kyi mchog dga' la sogs pa sbyar bar bya ste de bzhin du lus kyi lhan skyes la sogs pas so //
translated: Thus, one should apply the supreme joy of the body, and so on, and likewise, the co-emergence of the body, and so on.

original: de ltar lus kyi bral ba la sogs pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar lus kyi bral ba la sogs pas kyang ngo //
translated: Thus, one should also apply the separation of the body, and so on.

original: dga' ba bcu drug rnams so //
analyzed: dga' ba bcu drug rnams so //
translated: There are sixteen joys.

original: de thams cad bden pa'i sbyor bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin du lta ba de 'dis zhes bya ba ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: de thams cad bden pa'i sbyor bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin du lta ba de 'dis zhes bya ba ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: All of that is called the union of truth - the view of the nature of form, such as the body, etc. This is explained as it is.

original: da ni 'di'i slar yang r'ame shva ra la sogs pa'i yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig bstan par bzhed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di'i slar yang r'ame shva ra la sogs pa'i yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig bstan par bzhed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, wishing to teach the etymologies of the syllables Ra, Me, Sha, etc. again here, he says:

original: r'a me shva ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de bzhin du dad pa'i dbang po'i yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: r'a me shva ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de bzhin du dad pa'i dbang po'i yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Ra, Me, Sha, etc. - thus, the faculty of faith should also be understood in the same way.

original: mchog tu rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i rigs pa 'dis ye shes kyi rnam pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba de gsungs pa /
analyzed: mchog tu rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i rigs pa 'dis ye shes kyi rnam pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba de gsungs pa /
translated: Supremely marvelous - by this reasoning of syllables, that which is called the form of the aspect of wisdom is stated.

original: 'dod ces bya ba sogs pa ste r'a'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod ces bya ba sogs pa ste r'a'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: Desire and so forth is the meaning of the syllable Ra.

original: de ltar 'dod chags 'dod chags min 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bral ba'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags 'dod chags min 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bral ba'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Thus, desire, non-desire, and their mixture - the joy of separation is free from desire.

original: 'dod chags ni mchog dga' ste de 'dres par gyur pas /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni mchog dga' ste de 'dres par gyur pas /
translated: Desire is supreme joy, and by their mixture,

original: spyi'i lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig la ye shes kyi rnam pa'i gzugs med pa'am yang na yod pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig la ye shes kyi rnam pa'i gzugs med pa'am yang na yod pa'o //
translated: In general, in the moment of the innate, the form of the aspect of intuition does not exist, or else it does exist.

original: de'i tshe dri ma med pa de rnams kyis 'khor ba la gnas te mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dri ma med pa de rnams kyis 'khor ba la gnas te mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: At that time, those who are stainless abide in cyclic life, and are not in supreme nirvana.

original: de'i tshe 'di nyid kyis bskyed par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di nyid kyis bskyed par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: At that time, in order to generate that, he says:

original: me ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste me'i yi ge'i don te dbus su zhas bya ba ni lnga pa'i don du gnyis pa ste de nyid @215b bshad pa dbus las bdud rtsi'i gnas la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: me ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste me'i yi ge'i don te dbus su zhas bya ba ni lnga pa'i don du gnyis pa ste de nyid @215b bshad pa dbus las bdud rtsi'i gnas la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The fire, etc., is the meaning of the syllable ‚Äúme‚Äù in the middle, which is the second in the fifth. That is explained as ‚Äúin the middle, in the place of nectar.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi sems 'gro ba'i dus su de'i dbus su gang de lhan cig skyes pa de'i dbus kyi bar las bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'gro ba'i dus su de'i dbus su gang de lhan cig skyes pa de'i dbus kyi bar las bskyed pa'o //
translated: When the bodhicitta moves, in the middle of that, that which is innate is generated from the middle of that.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: That is its special feature.

original: 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid yid las zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa nyid 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can de des gzugs rnams su sor snang ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid yid las zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa nyid 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can de des gzugs rnams su sor snang ngo //
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: the five elements are the nature of mind. The five elements are the nature of the innate. They appear as forms by that.

original: rang gi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩci'i phyir 'byung ba lnga yin de'i phyir yin gsung pa /
analyzed: rang gi sems zhes bya ba'i don to // ci'i phyir 'byung ba lnga yin de'i phyir yin gsung pa /
translated: The meaning is that they are one's own mind.üîΩWhy are they the five elements?

original: dbugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sha'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: dbugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sha'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: the five elements are the nature of the innate.

original: de ltar dbugs kyi 'khor lo drug brgyas lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ste de yang 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dkyil 'khor lnga lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dbugs kyi 'khor lo drug brgyas lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ste de yang 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dkyil 'khor lnga lngar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths. Those are divided into twelve transits, becoming five mandalas each.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin rnams te de ltar rgyun du de'i zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gzugs 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin rnams te de ltar rgyun du de'i zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gzugs 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The natures of earth, water, fire, wind, and space. Thus, the meaning of the verse is that the innate form arises from the five elements.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bza' bar bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi sar rab tu zhugs shing gshegs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste de'i tshe de rnams su 'byung ba lnga rnams za ba ste dmigs pa med par byas pa'i don du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bza' bar bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi sar rab tu zhugs shing gshegs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste de'i tshe de rnams su 'byung ba lnga rnams za ba ste dmigs pa med par byas pa'i don du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata is one who has gone to the stage of thusness, and he eats the five elements that occur at that time. The meaning is that he makes them non-apprehensible.

original: 'di'i de ltar byas pa gsungs pa rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i de ltar byas pa gsungs pa rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the author states the way in which this is done:

original: ra'i yi ge'i don gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: ra'i yi ge'i don gyis kyang ngo //
translated: By the meaning of the syllable ra,

original: 'dir lha rnams ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lha rnams ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the gods are the eyes, etc.

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams dang la pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa dang dbang po'i bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni klu rnams so //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams dang la pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa dang dbang po'i bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni klu rnams so //
translated: The aggregates, etc., the hands, feet, etc., and the activities of the senses, etc. are the nagas.

original: yan lag sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams te de rnams la mkhas pas rol pa ni sngon du bshad pa'i sbyor ba la goms pas rtse zhing kun nas 'khor ba'i 'khor lor gnas pas so //
analyzed: yan lag sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams te de rnams la mkhas pas rol pa ni sngon du bshad pa'i sbyor ba la goms pas rtse zhing kun nas 'khor ba'i 'khor lor gnas pas so //
translated: The various elements, the sense bases, etc. are the various limbs, etc. The wise one plays with them, i.e., he sports with them by being habituated to the previously explained yoga, by abiding in the wheel of the all-encompassing.

original: des mngon par dus thams cad du skad cig thams cad du 'pho'o zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i gzugs spro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des mngon par dus thams cad du skad cig thams cad du 'pho'o zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i gzugs spro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It radiates means that it radiates in all times and in all moments.  Manifests means that it radiates in various forms.

original: de ltar gzugs yang gang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs yang gang 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the form like?

original: dpe ni bo la kakkola la skye bar 'gyur te /üîΩgzugs gzhan mang po de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpe ni bo la kakkola la skye bar 'gyur te / gzugs gzhan mang po de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: It is like a b and a k.

original: dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to explain that there are many other forms, it is said, nine, and so on.

original: sgo dgu'i bdag nyid nam mkha' ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rtsa dbu ma ste de'i sgo rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams te de rnams kyi dbus su ji ltar @216a * //
analyzed: sgo dgu'i bdag nyid nam mkha' ni // zhes bya ba ni rtsa dbu ma ste de'i sgo rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams te de rnams kyi dbus su ji ltar @216a * //
translated: The space of the nine doors

original: khyim dang khang ba brtsegs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khyim dang khang ba brtsegs pa bzhin no //
translated: means the central channel, and the doors of that are the eyes and so on. In the middle of those, like a house or a mansion, is the b and the k.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni de mngon par shes nas bzhi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mngon du bshad pa'i mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i rtsa ste de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni de mngon par shes nas bzhi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mngon du bshad pa'i mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i rtsa ste de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: The space is the space of the central channel.  Having understood that, means having understood that the central channel is like a house or a mansion.  Four times refers to the channels such as the avadh≈´tƒ´, which have been explained above.  Just so, and so on, explains that in the same way.

original: de ltar sgo 'di rnams kyi rdo rje phag mos sprul pa'i sku mi'u thung ma lta bur 'dri ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar sgo 'di rnams kyi rdo rje phag mos sprul pa'i sku mi'u thung ma lta bur 'dri ba gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, Vajravarahi, through these doors, speaks as if she were a little person, an emanation.

original: sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The question, What is the door? and so on.

original: dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i 'gro ba yon tan skyon kyang kye bcom ldan 'das mi shes pas de'i rang bzhin ji ltar 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i 'gro ba yon tan skyon kyang kye bcom ldan 'das mi shes pas de'i rang bzhin ji ltar 'gyur zhes so //
translated: The division is the going of consciousness, and also the qualities and faults. O Bhagavati, not knowing, how can one's nature be?

original: de nyid kyi lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi lan gsungs pa /
translated: The answer to that is stated:

original: nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: By listen! and so on.

original: 'dis tha mal pa'i 'khor ba pa rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams sems can rnams kyi 'pho pa'i dus su bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis tha mal pa'i 'khor ba pa rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams sems can rnams kyi 'pho pa'i dus su bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This explains the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions of ordinary samsaric beings, at the time of the transmigration of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sgo glegs sbyin par bya ste nam mkha'i rnam pa nyid kyis ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i gzugs rdzogs pa ste thar pa'i gzugs kyi phyag rgya las zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sgo glegs sbyin par bya ste nam mkha'i rnam pa nyid kyis ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i gzugs rdzogs pa ste thar pa'i gzugs kyi phyag rgya las zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the door bolt of the yogis is given, and by the aspect of space, the form of wisdom and consciousness is perfected. From the seal of the form of liberation is the determination.

original: gzhan rtogs bar sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs bar sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: da ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sngon du bshad pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa'i gzugs de rnams kyis rnam par dag bsgom pa'i lam rnams su gsal bar mdzad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sngon du bshad pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa'i gzugs de rnams kyis rnam par dag bsgom pa'i lam rnams su gsal bar mdzad pa gsungs pa /
